The current assault on the voting rights of everyday citizens, in Texas and across the country, must end. Our democracy is at an inflection point, and we must restore and strengthen protections for voters, starting with the landmark Voting Rights Act.

7⃣ Supply chain security is crucial for America’s defense and our economy — that’s why the House’s version of the #FY22NDAA includes a range of solutions to protect America’s defense supply chains.
6⃣ H.R. 4350 prioritizes America’s cybersecurity needs, authorizing nearly $1 billion in new investments toward the people, programs, and technologies that secure the United States in cyberspace.

5⃣ Succeeding in strategic competition also means investing in the American people.

That’s why the #FY22NDAA supports a 2.7% pay increase for service members — and establishes a $15/hour minimum wage for the hardworking Americans who power our defense industrial base.

4⃣ The #FY22NDAA also requires interagency reports to Congress on Beijing and Moscow’s influence operations targeting U.S. military alliances and partnerships.

We must face these common threats together.
3⃣ H.R. 4530 authorizes full funding for the European Deterrence Initiative (EDI) to help America’s European allies and partners meet our shared defense challenges.

2⃣ NATO plays a crucial role for America’s national security priorities.

That’s why the #FY22NDAA expresses the sense of Congress in strong support of the U.S. commitment to the NATO alliance and to America’s European partners.

1⃣ America’s alliances and partnerships represent a key competitive advantage — and H.R. 4350 robustly funds the president’s budget request for the Pacific Deterrence Initiative (PDI) with nearly $9 billion for PDI programs.

THREAD: Protecting America’s national security requires addressing both current and future defense threats.
